summary: This is an FBI request for authority to use a non-Bureau undercover employee (UCE) in an investigation related to Jeffrey Epstein. The document details that an attorney representing four women suing Epstein was contacted by a former Epstein employee who was attempting to sell documents relevant to the civil case for $50,000, in violation of a federal subpoena. The FBI seeks to have the UCE pose as a buyer to gather evidence.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of a civil lawsuit brought by four female individuals. A former employee of his is attempting to sell documents related to this case.

events.title: Former Epstein employee contacts attorney with document offer
events.description: A former employee of Jeffrey Epstein contacted an attorney representing plaintiffs suing Epstein, attempting to sell documents pertinent to the civil case for $50,000, despite being under a federal subpoena to produce them.

events.title: FBI requests undercover operation authority
events.description: The FBI drafts a request for Special Agent in Charge (SAC) authority to utilize a non-Bureau undercover employee to pose as a buyer for the documents being illegally offered by the former Epstein employee.

keyFacts: A former employee of Jeffrey Epstein attempted to sell documents related to a civil lawsuit against Epstein to an attorney representing the plaintiffs for $50,000.
The former employee was under a federal subpoena to produce these documents, making the attempt to sell them illegal.
The FBI sought authorization to run an undercover operation, using an employee to pose as a buyer, to collect evidence of this attempted crime.
The document indicates an active FBI investigation (Case ID 72-MM-113327) into potential obstruction related to the Epstein civil case (FBI case 31E-MM-108062).
